title: Jeremy Edwards hits out at judges on X Factor Celebrity over 'unnecessary' comments
text:

Holby City actor Jeremy Edwards has admitted he found the judges comments hard to deal with on his appearance on X Factor Celebrity.

The star formed a group with Strictly Come Dancing professional dancer Brendan Cole, as the creatively-named "Cole and Edwards".

The pair, who have known each other for a decade, will be looking to impress judges Simon Cowell, Louis Walsh and Nicole Scherzinger and scoop a record deal.

But the judging process has been a knock to their confidence as Jeremy confessed he struggled with their criticism, particularly from American Idol judges Randy Jackson and Howie Mandel, who appear on the show.

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX)

Speaking to MirrorOnline at the press launch, he explained that his band mate Brendan was able to take it on the chin because of his Strictly experience.

Jeremy said: “This was just me, I can’t speak for Brendan on this… Brendan is more used to it than I am.

"They edited down quite a lot of what Howie said and I’m gonna be completely honest with you, I don’t think a lot of it was necessary.

“That’s all cos I don’t mind criticism, and certain things didn’t work but certain things did and there was a lot of positives there, but A, he talked for ages and B, it was negative, negative, negative.”

(Image: Dymond/Thames/Syco)

Brendan added: “Luckily Nicole and Simon were really nice to us.”

Jeremy: “And Louis was nice. At one point I wanted to say, ‘dude, you’re not even a judge so can you shut up.

"It only matters what these three say.'”

Also appearing as contestants on the show are former Love Island cast members.

Wes Nelson has teamed up with Eyal Booker, Zara McDermott and Samira Mighty to form supergroup The Islanders.

The foursome revealed they'd actually auditioned for Simon Cowell's latest project separately before being put together - "like Little Mix", they claim.

They also predicted they might be put in the 'groups' category after being ITV bosses 'heard them harmonising' together in the villa.

Though they claim scenes of them performing never went to air because of "copyright issues".

(Image: WireImage)

Joining The Islanders in the group category are Try Star made up of Thom Evans, Levi Davis and Ben Foden.

While Megan McKenna, Glee’s Kevin McHale, EastEnders’ Jonny Labey will all be competing in the Unders category.

The Overs consists of journalist Martin Bashir, actress Victoria Ekanoye and talk show host Ricki Lake.

Find out how they fare when the show kicks off this weekend.

The X Factor: Celebrity airs on ITV 12 October at 8:35pm
description: The actor has teamed up with Brendan Cole for the new celeb version of the singing competition, but found the critiques hard to swallow
